citation.abstract: The recent development of a novel class of insulin-sensitizing drugs, the thiazolidinediones (TZDs), represents a significant advance in antidiabetic therapy. One key mechanism by which these drugs exert their effects is by activation of the peroxisome proliferator activated receptor gamma (PPAR-gamma), a member of the nuclear receptor family. Evidence supporting this mechanism of action of the TZDs will be reviewed in this article. Recent data suggests that PPAR-gamma agonists might also have therapeutic potential in the treatment of inflammatory diseases and certain cancers.
citation.title: PPAR-gamma agonists: therapeutic role in diabetes, inflammation and cancer.

blogs.title: Of Mice and Methamphetamine
blogs.summary:
Diabetes drug being tested for addiction.
It’s a mouthful: peroxisome proliferator activated receptor gamma (PPAR-gamma).  
Peroxisomes are specialized subunits inside cells that help metabolize various substances, including fatty acids and certain toxins
